MEMORANDUM BY THE SECRETARY OF STATE FOR SCOTLAND.This hill provides for the registration and inspection of maternity homes in Scotland and prohibits (except in cases of sudden and urgent necessity) attendance on women in childbirth by persons not qualified under the Midwives (Scotland) Act, The Bill, which follows oloaely the lines of a similar English measure passed labt year. h&b now completed all its stages in the House of Commons, where amendments were made which secured its passage as an agreed measure. It is a useful Bill and I ask the ooncurrence of my colleagues to its being treated in thB House of LordB as a Government measure.'JOHN OILMOUR.'Scottish Office,Whitehall, S.W.I. 29th June, 1927.
